intro: Hieracium canencianum, commonly known as the Canencian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium canencianum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
